intro: Bogoria moorei, commonly known as the African waterwheel, is a flowering plant native to Africa. It is a member of the Polygonaceae family, which includes plants like buckwheat. The plant is characterized by its distinctive whorled arrangement of leaves and its ability to thrive in wetland environments. Its flowers are small and clustered, typically appearing in shades of pink or white. Bogoria moorei plays an important ecological role in its habitat by providing food and shelter for various wildlife species.
